intro: Rinorea sprucei, commonly known as the white-flowered rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Rinorea sprucei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
